Extra Train Service for Women's March, Sat., Jan. 20

On Saturday, Jan. 20, Metro-North will provide additional trains on the Hudson and New Haven lines to accommodate passengers traveling to and from the Women's March being held in New York City. In addition, please expect larger than normal crowds at Grand Central Terminal during the day. Two additional trains will be added to the morning inbound service on the Hudson and New Haven lines respectively. Additional trains for the afternoon outbound service will be added on an as-needed basis. See full details here: http://ow.ly/5wsY30hT1M3

An explanation for this morning's (Friday, Jan. 19) Harlem Line Delays

The delays you experienced this morning were the result of two separate problems that hampered our operating flexibility and created congestion on the Harlem Line. At approximately 5:20 AM a switch malfunctioned at North White Plains Station, taking one of two tracks in the area out of service. Crews were dispatched to the scene and were able to make repairs by 6:06 AM. Also, at 7:12 AM a train became temporarily disabled with damaged third rail shoes in the vicinity of Scarsdale Station due to a third rail "pull apart." This is when two sections of third rail separate (pull apart) at a point where they are joined. (This is caused when rail "shrinks" due to extremely cold weather, and separates at a joint.) Again, this took one of two tracks out of service in the area, adding to delays. Crews were able to clear the train from the area at approximately 8:40 AM, and the track condition was repaired by 9:15 AM. We regret any inconvenience you may have experienced as a result of these service disruptions.

Due to the winter storm please take care when traveling during inclement weather and allow for additional time to get to your station. Delays, cancellations and train combinations may occur depending upon the severity of the snow storm and its impact on our service territory. Customers should use caution when entering and exiting trains, and on platforms and staircases. For service updates please monitor www.mta.info/mnr, download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. For information on our Guide to Winter Weather Travel read more here: http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

A weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines on Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Monday, January 15. An additional outbound train to Port Jervis will depart Hoboken at 5:19 PM and Penn Station-NY at 5:11 PM. See our schedules page at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtranist.com for train times.
Metro-North's Martin Luther King Jr. Holiday Service (Monday, January 15)

Metro-North will operate an enhanced Saturday schedule with additional inbound trains in the morning and outbound trains in the afternoon/evening. All extra trains are shown in the current October 6 timetables or see our schedules page at https://goo.gl/ZOvn for more details. Grand Central North will be closed. The Hudson Rail Link and the Haverstraw-Ossining and Newburgh-Beacon ferries will operate on special schedules. See our Connecting Service page at https://goo.gl/1wwFCe for details.

Port Jervis/Pascack Valley Line Martin Luther King Jr. Holiday Service (Monday, January 15)

A weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Lines on Martin Luther King Jr. Day, Monday, January 15. On the Port Jervis line additional inbound trains will depart Port Jervis at 6:22 AM and 4:09 PM. An additional outbound train to Port Jervis will depart Hoboken at 5:19 PM and Penn Station-NY at 5:11 PM. See our schedules page at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtranist.com for train times.
Metro-North's Martin Luther King Jr. Holiday Service (Monday, January 15)

Metro-North will operate an enhanced Saturday schedule with additional inbound trains in the morning and outbound trains in the afternoon/evening. All extra trains are shown in the current October 6 timetables or see our schedules page at https://goo.gl/ZOvn for more details. Grand Central North will be closed. The Hudson Rail Link and the Haverstraw-Ossining and Newburgh-Beacon ferries will operate on special schedules. See our Connecting Service page at https://goo.gl/1wwFCe for details.

Five AM Peak trains to and three PM Peak trains from Penn Station will be diverted. Two PM Peak trains from Penn Station will be canceled. Customers should consider: Riding at the start or end of peak hours; Avoid Penn by traveling to/from Atlantic Terminal or Hunterspoint Avenue. If traveling for leisure, avoid rush hour

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service On Friday, Jan. 5 due to Impact of Winter Storm & Extremely Low Temperatures

Metro-North will operate a reduced weekday schedule on Friday, January 5 with some combined and cancelled trains due to the impact of the winter storm and extremely low temperatures on our train service and our infrastructure. Customers should anticipated scattered delays throughout our service territory.. Please refer to the current timetable and see a list of cancelled combined trains at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html . You can also download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. Or call our Customer Information Center at 511 (in Connecticut call 877-690-5114). Customers should anticipate delays and use caution when entering/exiting trains, and on platforms /staircases. For more information read our Guide to Winter Weather Travel at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service On Friday, Jan. 5 due to Impact of Winter Storm & Extremely Low Temperatures

Metro-North will operate a reduced weekday schedule on Friday, January 5 with some combined and cancelled trains due to the impact of the winter storm and extremely low temperatures on our train service and our infrastructure. Please refer to the current timetable and see a list of cancelled combined trains at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html . You can also download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. Or call our Customer Information Center at 511 (in Connecticut call 877-690-5114). Customers should anticipate delays and use caution when entering/exiting trains, and on platforms /staircases. For more information read our Guide to Winter Weather Travel at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service On Friday, Jan. 5 due to Impact of Winter Storm & Extremely Low Temperatures

Metro-North will operate a reduced weekday schedule on Friday, January 5 with some combined and cancelled trains due to the impact of the winter storm and extremely low temperatures on our train service and our infrastructure. Please refer to the current timetable and see a list of cancelled combined trains at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html . You can also download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. Or call our Customer Information Center at 511 (in Connecticut call 877-690-5114). Customers should anticipate delays and use caution when entering/exiting trains, and on platforms /staircases. For more information read our Guide to Winter Weather Travel at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

LIRR AM Advisory for Friday, January 5

LIRR personnel will be working through the night, doing everything possible to keep our rails free of snow & ice so we can run normal service in the morning, but the lingering effects of Thursday's major storm, as well as the extremely cold temperatures, may impact Friday AM service. Customers are advised to allow extra travel time in the morning and check for potential weather-related delays before traveling. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info/lirr, sign up for MYMTAALERTS email & text alerts or follow us on Twitter

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service Due to Impact of Winter Storm & Extremely Low Temperatures

For the remainder of today (Thursday, January 4, 2018) Metro-North is operating a reduced weekday schedule with some combined and cancelled trains due to the impact of the winter storm and extremely low temperatures on our train service and our infrastructure. Please refer to the current timetable and see a list of cancelled/combined trains at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html . You can also download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. Or call our Customer Information Center at 511 (in Connecticut call 877-690-5114). Customers should anticipate delays and use caution when entering/exiting trains, and on platforms /staircases. For more information read our Guide to Winter Weather Travel at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service Due to Impact of Winter Storm & Extremely Low Temperatures

For the remainder of today (Thursday, January 4, 2018) Metro-North is operating a reduced weekday schedule with some combined and cancelled trains due to the impact of the winter storm and extremely low temperatures on our train service and our infrastructure. Please refer to the current timetable and see a list of cancelled/combined trains at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html . You can also download our TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook. Or call our Customer Information Center at 511 (in Connecticut call 877-690-5114). Customers should anticipate delays and use caution when entering/exiting trains, and on platforms /staircases. For more information read our Guide to Winter Weather Travel at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/WinterWeatherTravelTips.html

DUE TO HIGH WINDS AND ROAD CONDITIONS CERTAIN TYPES OF VEHICLES ARE NOT PERMITTED TO CROSS THE WHITESTONE BRIDGE. . Step Vans . Tractor Trailers . House Trailers . Cars pulling trailers . Mini Buses . Motorcycles . Vehicles transporting plate glass, signs or any cargo which is deemed to be vulnerable to dislodging or disintegration in high wind, or which so increases the wind resistance of the carrying vehicle as to render that vehicle not safely drivable . Vehicles loaded in such a manner as may present a hazard to themselves or others on the bridge. . Vehicles whose height has been altered from manufacturer's specifications. . Any other vehicle(s) that, in the opinion of posted personnel from the Authority, are likely to present a hazard under existing conditions.

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Connecticut Department of Transportation New Haven Line Fare Increase for Travel from Connecticut Stations Effective January 1

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect for stations on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2018. This is the last of seven consecutive annual fare increases that were previously authorized to fund the purchase of M8 rail cars. The changes will affect ticket prices for travel: Between stations within Connecticut; Between Connecticut and New York stations. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. See full details and fares at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/fare_CTincrease2018.htm

Special New Year's Weekend Service thru Monday, Jan 1

Ring in the New Year with Metro-North! Whether you are watching the ball drop on Time's Square or hanging with friends, the best way to get there is with our special New Year's service. On Sun., Dec. 31, our New Year's Eve service includes extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service, and "overnight" New Year's early morning service. Those of you taking our early morning New Year's service will have your tickets collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Buy your train tickets in advance: We suggest you use MTA eTix, the mobile ticketing app http://www.mta.info/mta-eTix-promo . On New Year's Day, Mon., Jan. 1, 2018, we will operate hourly service on most line segments, and regular weekend service on branch lines. For both Sunday and Monday, see our Christmas/ New Year's Holiday timetable for service, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/schedules.htm or our Train Time app, http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/traintimeapp.htm **Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from noon New Year's Eve until noon New Year's Day. ** All of us at Metro-North wish you a safe and happy New Year! For more information about the New Years service, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/nye_holidayservice.htm
